com.moloco.van.context

Class MolocoEntryPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moloco.van.context.MolocoEntryPoint

  • public class MolocoEntryPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    Entry point of VAN SDK. Once init(Context, String) is called, sendEvent(String, HashMap, ApiCallback) will be able to connect to the VAN server. Any event queued before this is initialized will be sent sequentially after initialization. This singleton class must be accessed by its static methods only.

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
        Gets initialized.
        Returns:
        initialized

      • setAppName

        public void setAppName(java.lang.String appName)
        Sets a new app name and replace the existing one. The package name of the mother app will be used in case of empty name.
        Parameters:
        appName - name of the app.

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.Context context,
                        java.lang.String appName)
        Initializes MolocoEntryPoint with context and app name. Please pick the app name carefully to make it uniquely identified. Contact Moloco (http://www.molocoads.com/) if you're not sure how to name it.
        Parameters:
        context - the Android Context
        appName - name of the app, expected to be unique

      • sendEvent

        public static void sendEvent(java.lang.String evtName,
                             java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap,
                             ApiCallback<java.lang.String> apiCallback)
        Sends an event to VAN server. Device and user information such as model, carrier and idfa along with user defined data in dataMap will be sent to VAN.
        Parameters:
        evtName - name of this event
        dataMap - user defined data
        apiCallback - callback to get the result of this event
